name: Suite Hotel Elba Castillo San Jorge & Antigua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a weeks holiday at this hotel. Fuerteventura and Caleta are lovely. The hotel is a joke. Very basic accommodation. Security is a joke! We were broken into and our safe was stolen. We were moved to another room and the patio doors were locked with a hook and eye and the window to our bedroom did not have a lock. Theft in the area is rife so be careful. Hotel was unhelpful and not interested. Thomas Cook were fantastic and if it wasnt for them we would not have got sorted out.
reviews.title: Security needs to be looked at!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a difficult few months towards the end of 2012 me and my partner just wanted a week away from everything in the sunshine and that's exactly what we got.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel In A Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We departed from Birmingham on 27/12/12 (Ryanair - joy) and landed in Fuerteventura around 6pm, we then waited an hour for our transfer ... (Viajes Urbis - provided by travel republic - Do not use! rubbish service and rude driver, just get a taxi, 10 mins, 10 euros - bargain!)
reviews.title: chipmunk hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel about 8pm, as we were the only 2 checking in the process was very speedy and we were allocated room 2233 (in the san jorge block), 1 bedroom apartment with sea view.
reviews.title: fidelity card rubbish

reviews.title: Everybody's different 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: food was fine plenty of choice and watch the beer it blows your head off lol.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel & very dated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the base for our first ever christmas abroad and we had a great time. We were only self catering and went out every night so cannot comment on the food or entertainment but if you are looking for a cheap, clean, well located place to stay with stunning sea views then you can't really go wrong. There are two main pools, a "noisy" one full of kids where the towls went down at 6 in the morning and a quiet one where we never had a problem getting a lounger. The complez is well designed with the 3 Aparthotels joined together and several independent bars and places to eat set up around the ground floor perimeter. We did try most of them over the course of the week. El Meson Gallego is a fab little tapas bar, very reasonablr prices, The kings arms shows all the footy and has karaoke nights, Luna Blue does nice cocktails (particularly the Mojitos) and has free wi-fi , (very handy especially as we could hook onto it from our apartment!) but our personal Favourite was the Dog & Duck run by a really friendly couple serving huge measures at great prices. We had a brilliant time and it certainly won't be the last time we spend christmas abroad in Caleta. Roll on the next one :o)
reviews.title: Great Location and Price - Would stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i arrived in Fuerteventura at lunchtime and proceeded to wait for the bus to take us to the hotel.Upon reading our transfer voucher we realised we could have up to an hours wait for the bus for a trip that would only take ten minutes and so we paid the 12 euros for a taxi...well worth it! Our check in was quick and efficient and we were grateful of the room upgrade to a two bedroomed apartment in the San Jorge part of the hotel,massive for the two of us and not a seaview but as it turned out we got the sun in the evening unlike many of the sea front apartments.The cleanliness was not the best and i didnt appreciate that clean towels were left in the bidet!Our main concern was security as the front desk in this part of the hotel is unmanned at this time of year,anyone could just walk through the building unnoticed and it was very quiet,other than that we were happy with the location just off the seafront walk and minutes from the centre.We didnt use any facilities apart from the inner pool which was freezing!Also the Dog and Duck bar beneath the San Jorge which was good and cheap and very welcoming.Overall it was the break we wanted,nice weather when its snowing in Britain!
reviews.title: Good location but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the San Jorge part of the hotel from 16 December 2012 until 09 January 2013. These are our honest personal opinions:
reviews.title: Honest & Personal Holiday Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good Points:
reviews.title: Not Good but!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated on the seafront and is only 10 minutes away from the airport and costs between 10 and 15 euros. The hotel provides access onto the promenade and you can walk or cycle in either direction for miles. Bars, cafes and restaurants are literally a few minutes walk away with many offering a menu of the day (menu del dia) around 6 or 7 euros and the resort felt very safe. Our room was bright, spacious and clean, housekeeping everyday except Thursday & Sunday and a mini market on site if you didn’t fancy the walk into town. We like to eat where the locals eat, so stayed on a self catering basis, the kitchenette was well equipped (fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster). The public areas are kept clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the cleaners who are always smiling. Free bus service to town and golf courses. An abundance of hot water anytime day or night.
reviews.title: Great entertainers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were given a room which was supposed to be upgraded we had a two bedroomed apartment that was at the side of the hotel.This room was filthy, we found toys under the bed and the walls and floors were very dirty.We had to go to reception on many occasions to have things fixed.
reviews.title: Had a good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked to be moved 4 times from this cold dirty room that had no sunshine at all.Eventually we moved to a 1 bedroomed appartment where we did get sunshine in the afternoon it was so nice to be able to sit out and have a drink,and be able to dry our clothes. The walls were still very dirty in this room, we cleaned them ourselves we were fedup of complaining, for the rest of the holiday we were greatful for the move. Some of the reception staff made us feel like idiots when we asked to move, and told us to go back the next day and we could have a new room this didnt happen until 7 days later.The pool was green midue around the sides which was brushed away by a man occasionally not many people went into the water.The Good side was the food, it was amazing, there was nothing that we could complain about. Staff in restraunt were very kind and helpful.The wonderful entertainment team worked very hard and kept both the kids and adults entertained,We went every night to see them, Frank and Oswald well done you deserve a rise, wish we could have you at every hotel, you made our holiday fun and entertaining you both are worth your weight in GOLD.The shows were good except for those with birds and animals I felt all they wanted was money for photos The lady at the large pool bar INIS is such a helpful kind hard working person I would have liked to bring her home.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First time in the Canaries and really enjoyed our stay....just got back on the 19th Jan. We stayed in the San Jorge part of the hotel and the room was spacious and clean ...maids came in every other day. Food was lovely something to suit all tastes ...even the fussy eater would have found something to eat. We were all inclusive so it was good to just eat and drink when we felt like it. Entertainment was good on the nights we went but we went out most nights.. Visited Legends bar had a great night in there. Also Piero's Cafe what a night in there please go here you won't be disappointed . Was lovely to see the little chimpmunks lol. The staff were courteous and I couldn't fault them ...weather was good so all in all had a good holiday . Would go back here .
reviews.title: Tired decor, disappointing 'rules'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a self catering basis and had a one bedroom apartment with a sea view, which is definitely worth having. We sat out there every morning having our breakfast as that was when the sun was on it, rather than in the late afternoon. The apartment was very spacious, no problems with that, but it is a bit tired and could do with a refurb. The TV very old, the wooden piece of furniture it was on was dilapidated. The doors to the balcony had some black tape on one of the windows, presumably to hold the glass in. The windows in the bathroom had tissue paper stuffed in them too. There were two rings for cooking which we didnt use, toaster and kettle, microwave and fridge. Worth getting an Elba card before you go as you get given 2 bottles of beer, water and ans of coke as a welcome gift put in the fridge. Apartment was kept clean and towels replaced. The pool was freezing cold! Some of the sunbeds seemed to collapse on people (we saw two people literally sit down and fall through them!) but ours were ok and there were plenty to use. The pool in the middle of the hotel didnt get as much sun as the other one by the sea but perhaps it's different at other times of the year. It was 20 euros for the safe for a week (plus 10 euros deposit) which seemed expensive to me, but whilst there we heard from other guests that some rooms had been broken into over the new year period so clearly it's worthwhile paying for the safe. Mind you we were also told that someone stole an entire safe from a room so don't know what to make of that! We wanted to upgrade to half board while we were there and the offer was that you could do that for 15 euros per day. We went to the reception in the evening to ask if this was possible to do for a day and was told this was fine, we should go back in the morning so that the breakfast would start from then. When we went back in the morning we were told it would cost 20 euros not 15. When we asked why, we were told that to get the rate of 15 per day you had to have 3 days worth of upgrade not just one. That was fine, we said we would do 3 days - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday and was then told we couldn't do that either! It had to be 3 consecutive days (which we didnt want to do as we were meeting friends for dinner in between for my birthday). I said what difference does it make that its not 3 consecutive days, surely having someone upgrade for 3 days is better than none at all? The reception manager said she understood but they were the rules from head office and she wouldn't budge. Therefore we didn't upgrade at all, Makes no business sense to create obstacles to customer satisfaction when we probably would've bought more drinks there too, what a daft 'rule' to have. I also pointed out to the manager that it does not say this on the bit of paper advertising the upgrade rates to which she shrugged her shoulders. In the end we made the most of some local restaurants where we had lovely food so glad we didn't bother! The location is good, about 10 minute walk to the centre. The resort itself is not the busiest in January but plenty going on, especially at Pieros and Hemmingways bar. We still managed some very late nights! Lovely to walk all the way along the beach. Recommend Fado Rock, le Patio, 15 restaurants and Slow Boat for great meal for jsut 6.50 euros. Would go back to Fuerteventura but probably try Correlejo next time. If I went back to Costa Caletta I would not stay here I would stay at the Barcelo.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We visited here 4th January for a week all inclusive. The hotel is excellent, the staff pleasant and helpfull. The food is lovely a really good selection and the grill bar to order fresh steaks, chicken, pork and tuna.The all inclusive drinks were okay. The hotel is situated in a great location, rooms cleaned every day except Thursday and one other day. Clean towels provided. Small bottles of water supplied whenever required. Pool was really cold so could not venture into it although some young ones did. The entertainment was quite good something on every night. We are certainly coming back to this hotel some time this year.
reviews.title: Smashing holiday

aka: Aparthotel Castillo San Jorge / Antigua / Caleta De Fuste
